--- Barbara Sheridan <bsher213@...>
wrote:
>Since Hachiro Kiyokawa�s plan to make Roshigumi
>serve for the Imperial 
>Court, instead of the Shogunate is revealed, the
>leaders of Roshigumi, 
>including Tadasaburo Sasaki decides to take the
>members back to Edo. 

 They probably won�t go into this in the series, but
when the Roshigumi split, and most went back to Edo,
those that went back were going to be used if a
possible war broke out with England in Edo. It never
did of course, but those members were to become the
Shinchogumi (Newly Formed Group). When Kiyokawa and
the men reached Edo they started stirring up trouble
in the city. 
 With the news of a possible insurrection against the
government and Kiyokawa became known as part of the
plot a hit was put out on him. He was killed on April
13, 1963 (I would say yesterday was the anniversary,
but I think that date is using the other calendar).
Anyways, the government then rounded up and imprisoned
the bad members of the group and those still around
became the Shinchogumi. I don�t know anything about
Tadasaburo Sasaki's role in even of this though.

 I take it that in the tv series that it will be the
end of episode 16 and then in episode 17 that Kondo
and company become the Shinsengumi. 

Kevin
